Identification.LongTitle: Denatured and Specially Denatured Alcohol Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of National Revenue, pursuant to paragraph 304(1)(o) of the Excise Act, 2001a, hereby makes the annexed Denatured and Specially Denatured Alcohol Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The specification for a grade of denatured alcohol set out in column 1 of Schedule 1 is the quantity of the denaturant set out in column 2 mixed with 100 L of spirits.
The specification for a grade of specially denatured alcohol set out in column 1 of Schedule 2 is the quantity of the denaturant set out in column 2 mixed with 100 L of spirits.

Where the volume of spirits to be denatured to a grade set out in column 1 of Schedule 1 or 2 is greater or less than 100 L, the quantity of denaturant used shall be in the same proportion to that volume of spirits that the quantity of the denaturant set out in column 2 of that Schedule is to 100 L.

Section.Text: The composition of the denatured alcohol grades set out in Schedule 1 and the specially denatured alcohol grades set out in Schedule 2 is stated in terms of ethyl alcohol of a minimum strength of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 75% absolute ethyl alcohol by volume at 20°C in the case of grade DA-2J; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 95% absolute ethyl alcohol by volume at 20°C in the case of all other grades.

Section.Text: A spirits licensee who denatures spirits shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the spirits and the denaturants are thoroughly mixed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the denaturant used is a denaturant set out in column 1 of the table to this section that possesses the characteristics set out in column 2.

row.entry: A clear colourless volatile liquid with a minimum purity of 98% by volume at 20°C.
A substance that meets the specifications set out in the latest edition of the National Formulary in which the denaturant appears as an official preparation.

A petroleum fuel that can be evaporated at atmospheric pressure, that boils within the range of 130°C to 400°C and that is for use in diesel engines.

A clear colourless solution of formaldehyde with a minimum concentration of formaldehyde of 37% by mass.

Provision.Text: A petroleum distillate — or a mixture of petroleum distillates, oxygenates or additives — that is suitable for use in a spark ignition engine and that has the following characteristics, as determined by the applicable test method listed in the Canadian General Standards Board Standard CAN/CGSB-3.5-2004, entitled Unleaded Automotive Gasoline, published November 2004, as amended from time to time;

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: a vapour pressure of at least 38 kPa;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: an antiknock index of at least 80;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: a distillation temperature, at which 10% of the fuel has evaporated, of not less than 35°C and not greater than 70°C; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: a distillation temperature, at which 50% of the fuel has evaporated, of not less than 65°C and not greater than 120°C.

A substance that meets the specifications set out in the latest edition of the National Formulary in which the denaturant appears as an official preparation.

A volatile, highly flammable liquid that has the characteristic odour of light petroleum distillate. Upon distillation, a maximum of 10% by volume of the liquid shall pass over at or below 35°C, or the liquid shall have a vapour pressure at 37.8°C (at a vapour-to-liquid ratio of 4:1) that is less than or equal to 105 kPa, and a minimum of 95% by volume of the liquid shall pass over at or below 225°C. Petroleum derivative does not include gasoline, petroleum naphtha or solvent naphtha

Provision.Text: A volatile, highly flammable liquid having the characteristic odour of petroleum naphtha and which meets the specifications set out in one of the following standards:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: Canadian General Standards Board Standard CAN/CGSB-3.27-M89, entitled Naphtha Fuel, published January 1989, as amended from time to time;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: Canadian General Standards Board Standard CAN/CGSB-1.5-M91, entitled Low Flash Petroleum Spirits Thinner, published December 1991, as amended from time to time;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: Canadian General Standards Board Standard CAN/CGSB-3.22-2002, entitled Wide Cut Type Aviation Turbine Fuel, published July 2002, as amended from time to time.

Section.Text: These Regulations are deemed to have taken effect on July 1, 2003.
